findings.title: The canister sandbox has vulnerable dependencies
findings.description: The canister sandbox codebase uses vulnerable or unmaintained Rust dependencies.

findings.title: Complete environment of the replica is passed to the sandboxed process
findings.description: The DFINITY team does not use environment variables for sensitive information. However, sharing the environment with the sandbox introduces a latent risk that system configuration data or other sensitive data could be leaked to the sandboxed process in the future.

findings.title: SELinux policy allows the sandbox process to write replica log messages
findings.description: The canister sandbox's SELinux policy allows compromised sandbox processes to spoof log messages on replica file descriptors.

findings.title: Canister sandbox system calls are not filtered using Seccomp
findings.description: The current implementation of the canister sandbox does not use Seccomp to filter outgoing system calls, relying on mandatory access controls (via SELinux) instead.

findings.title: Invalid system state changes cause the replica to panic
findings.description: Sending a WebAssembly (Wasm) execution output with invalid system state changes can cause the replica to panic, crashing the entire subnet.

findings.title: SandboxedExecutionController does not enforce memory size invariants
findings.description: The SandboxedExecutionController does not validate Wasm and stable memory sizes against corresponding page maps, allowing a compromised sandbox to report invalid memory sizes and use up cycles normally reserved for memory use.
